title: Desserts
name: Desserts
description:
A Map by Bratfarrar

Places for great desserts

properties.name: Antoine's Pastry Shop
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 317 Watertown St, Newton, MAAntoine\'s is the local Italian pastry shop. Their cinnamon crescents are delicious. Also a good place to pick up a pie.

properties.name: Athan's Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 1621 Beacon St, brookline, maThe most authentic European bakery in Boston. They have fantastic baklava, gelato, chocolates (dark, milk, hazelnut), and "biscuits" (it seems wrong to call them cookies). Fairly small - only two or three tables, so they\'re mostly for retail business. Fantastic!

properties.name: Belwood Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  11625 Barrington Ct, Los Angeles, CA 90049Great pastries. Good coffee. The place the locals (including stars) stop to fill up in the morning. Not much seating. A great way to wake up in the morning.

properties.name: Burdicks
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar52 brattle st, cambridge, maGreat chocolatier, definitely the best place in town for a dark chocolate hot chocolate. Frequently hard to find a seat, but that\'s only to be expected. They also sell retail chocolate.

properties.name: Creperie
properties.description: Posted by BratfarrarI don\'t know what this little creperie is called, but it does one thing (crepes) and it does it well. A little off the beaten path, not very well known, but worth a shot if it\'s late and you\'re looking for something other than ice cream.

properties.name: Extraordinary Desserts
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar  2929 5th Ave, san diego, caThe place is named appropriately - it\'s a phenomenal bakery/dessert place. Hands down the best place to bring a date in San Diego. There is always a line out the door, and I have never heard anyone complain (in general, people just kind of smile at each other and whisper about how it\'s always like this). Go. Now.

properties.name: Garden of Eden
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 571 Tremont St, Boston, MAAn upscale restaurant / bakery / coffee house - honestly, I\'ve never tried the food, but the desserts are divine. A great place for a date.

properties.name: Mike's Pastries
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar300 Hanover St, Boston, MaOne room filled from floor to ceiling with bread, cake, cannolis and every other imaginable form of pastry. It\'s become a bit too popular for it\'s own good, I think (the locals are sick of the out-of-towners), but it\'s hard to argue with their chocolate-dipped cannolis.

properties.name: Modern Pastry Shop
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar 257 Hanover Street, Boston, MAIt just got a facelift, but "The Modern" is the no-frills answer to Mike\'s across the street. They fill your cannolis while you wait, so that it doesn\'t have a chance to get soggy. Most Bostonians will have an opinion on whether Mike\'s or The Modern is better, and the only appropriate response is to see for yourself.

properties.name: Paris Creperie
properties.description: Posted by Bratfarrar278 Harvard St, brookline, maGood crepes (both savory and sweet), not much seating. Don\'t try and get an espresso drink - it will take ten minutes, and will taste like grounds.
